Lester Piggott.label: Lester Piggott
Lester Piggott.description: Lester Keith Piggott is a retired English professional jockey, popularly known as "The Long Fellow". With 4,493 career wins, including nine Epsom Derby victories, he is widely regarded as one of the greatest flat racing jockeys of all time. Wikipedia

Donald R. Pettinger.label: Donald R. Pettinger
Donald R. Pettinger.description: Donald R. Pettinger born December 21, 1961 in Holly, Colorado is an American jockey in Thoroughbred flat horse racing. Wikipedia

John J. Tammaro, Jr..label: John J. Tammaro, Jr.
John J. Tammaro, Jr..description: John J. Tammaro, Jr. was an American Thoroughbred racehorse trainer. Wikipedia

Con Errico.label: Con Errico
Con Errico.description: Con Errico was an American Thoroughbred horse racing jockey who went to prison after being convicted of race-fixing. Wikipedia

Gordon Glisson.label: Gordon Glisson
Gordon Glisson.description:
Gordon P. Glisson was an American Champion Thoroughbred horse racing jockey.
Born in Winnsboro, South Carolina, at age fifteen he and his mother moved to Seattle, Washington. Wikipedia
Gordon Glisson.Born: October 31, 1930, Winnsboro, South Carolina, United States

Ray Cochrane.label: Ray Cochrane
Ray Cochrane.description:
Ray Cochrane is a retired horse racing jockey and current sports agent.
He was the winning jockey in three of the five British Classic Races the Oaks Stakes, 1,000 Guineas Stakes on Midway Lady, trained ... Wikipedia

Sam Boulmetis, Sr..label: Sam Boulmetis, Sr.
Sam Boulmetis, Sr..description: Samuel A. Boulmetis, Sr. is a retired American Thoroughbred horse racing jockey who was inducted in the National Museum of Racing and Hall of Fame in 1973. Wikipedia

Jesus Castanon.label: Jesus Castanon
Jesus Castanon.description: Jesus Lopez Castanon is a Mexican jockey in American thoroughbred racing who won the 2011 Preakness Stakes. The son of a horse trainer, two brothers were also jockeys in Mexico. Wikipedia

Bart Cummings.label: Bart Cummings
Bart Cummings.description: James Bartholomew 'Bart' Cummings, AM is one of the most successful Australian racehorse trainers. He is known as the Cups King, referring to the Melbourne Cup, as he has won 'the race that stops a nation' a record twelve times. Wikipedia

Calvin Borel.label: Calvin Borel
Calvin Borel.description: Calvin H. Borel is an American jockey in thoroughbred horse racing and rode the victorious mount in the 2007 Kentucky Derby, the 2009 Kentucky Derby and the 2010 Kentucky Derby. Wikipedia
Calvin Borel.Born: November 7, 1966 (age 47), St. Martin Parish, Lafayette, LA Metropolitan Statistical Area, Louisiana, United States

Arthur Pickens.label: Arthur Pickens
Arthur Pickens.description:
Arthur Pickens was an American Thoroughbred horse racing jockey who won the most prestigious race in both the United States and Canada.
Pickens began his career working as an exercise rider in 1906. Wikipedia

Tyler Baze.label: Tyler Baze
Tyler Baze.description: Tyler Baze is an American Champion jockey. He was born into a racing family, since both of his parents were jockeys, as is his uncle, Gary Baze. His second cousin is U.S. Racing Hall of Fame jockey Russell Baze. Wikipedia

Herbert Jones (jockey).label: Herbert Jones
Herbert Jones (jockey).description:
Herbert Ebsworth Jones was a British Thoroughbred horse racing jockey.
He often rode horses for King Edward VII. Wikipedia

Bill Shoemaker.label: Bill Shoemaker
Bill Shoemaker.description: William Lee "Bill" Shoemaker was an American jockey. For 29 years he held the world record of number of professional jockey victories. Wikipedia

Dean McKeown.label: Dean McKeown
Dean McKeown.description: Dean Russell McKeown is a currently banned British Thoroughbred horse racing jockey. He embarked on his professional career as a teenager, earning his first win in 1977. Wikipedia

William Scott (jockey).label: William Scott
William Scott (jockey).description: William Scott was a British jockey. Known as "Bill", he was a brother of the renowned trainer John Scott who frequently conditioned horses that he rode. Wikipedia

Manny Mercer.label: Manny Mercer
Manny Mercer.description: Emmanuel Lionel "Manny" Mercer was a Thoroughbred horse racing jockey who was one of British racing's brightest stars when he died in a racing accident. A brother to jockey Joe Mercer, he was married to the daughter of trainer Harry Wragg. Wikipedia

Lance O'Sullivan.label: Lance O'Sullivan
Lance O'Sullivan.description:
Lance Anthony O'Sullivan, ONZM, is a former New Zealand jockey.
He won a record 2479 races by a New Zealand jockey, mainly in the 1980s, including the 1989 Japan Cup on champion mare Horlicks, which broke the world record over 2400m. Wikipedia

Stig H. Johansson.label: Stig H. Johansson
Stig H. Johansson.description: Stig Henry Johansson is a Swedish trotting trainer and former driver. He started his career as a professional trainer in 1969, and has during a large part of the career been a dominating force in Swedish trotting. Wikipedia

Ryan L. Moore.label: Ryan Moore
Ryan L. Moore.description: Ryan Lee Moore is a flat racing jockey, who was Champion Jockey in 2006, 2008 and 2009. He is the son of successful trainer Gary L. Moore and brother to jump jockeys Jamie Moore and Joshua Moore, and top amateur jockey Hayley Moore. Wikipedia

Eddie Ambrose.label: Eddie Ambrose
Eddie Ambrose.description: Edward E. "Eddie" Ambrose was an American jockey in Thoroughbred horse racing. In the 1910s and 1920s he rode for top owners such as Harry Payne Whitney, Willis Sharpe Kilmer, and Walter M. Jeffords. Wikipedia

Jacinto Vásquez.label: Jacinto Vásquez
Jacinto Vásquez.description: Jacinto Vásquez is a retired Hall of Fame thoroughbred jockey. He rode two Kentucky Derby winners, Foolish Pleasure in 1975 and Genuine Risk in 1980. He was also the regular jockey for the filly Ruffian. Wikipedia

John Bejshak.label: John Bejshak
John Bejshak.description: John Joseph Bejshak was a Canadian-born jockey who competed in American Thoroughbred horse racing best known as the rider of 1935 American Horse of the Year, Discovery. Wikipedia

Ralph Neves.label: Ralph Neves
Ralph Neves.description: Ralph P. Neves was an American Hall of Fame jockey in Thoroughbred horse racing. Born in Cape Cod, Massachusetts, Neves won 3,772 races, including 173 stakes, and was elected to the Racing Hall of Fame in 1960. Wikipedia
Ralph Neves.Born: August 26, 1916, Cape Cod, Massachusetts, United States

Steve Donoghue.label: Steve Donoghue
Steve Donoghue.description: Steve Donoghue was a leading English flat-race jockey in the 1910s and 1920s. He was Champion Jockey 10 times between 1914 and 1923 and was one of the most celebrated horse racing sportsmen after Fred ... Wikipedia

Barclay Tagg.label: Barclay Tagg
Barclay Tagg.description: Barclay Tagg is an American thoroughbred horse trainer. A 1961 graduate of Pennsylvania State University with a degree in Animal Husbandry, he is best known for conditioning Kentucky Derby, Preakness ... Wikipedia

Jack Westrope.label: Jack Westrope
Jack Westrope.description:
Jack Gordon Westrope was an American Hall of Fame jockey in Thoroughbred horse racing.
Born in Baker, Montana, Westrope was the son of racehorse owner/trainer W. T. Westrope. Wikipedia

Lucien Laurin.label: Lucien Laurin
Lucien Laurin.description: Lucien Laurin was a French-Canadian jockey and Hall of Fame Thoroughbred horse trainer. Wikipedia

Darrel McHargue.label: Darrel McHargue
Darrel McHargue.description: Darrel G. McHargue is a retired American Champion jockey in Thoroughbred horse racing. One of five children from a family not connected to horse racing, he was first introduced to riding as a teeneage boy when he rode a neighbor's Quarter Horse. Wikipedia
Darrel McHargue.Born: September 22, 1954 (age 59), Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, United States

Mike Manganello.label: Mike Manganello
Mike Manganello.description: Michael "Mike" Manganello is a retired American Thoroughbred horse racing jockey. Wikipedia

George Moore (jockey).label: George Moore
George Moore (jockey).description: George Thomas Donald Moore OBE was an Australian jockey and Thoroughbred horse trainer. He began his career in racing in 1939 in Brisbane where he quickly became one of the top apprentice jockeys and ... Wikipedia
Awards: BBC Overseas Sports Personality of the Year

Ruperto Donoso.label: Ruperto Donoso
Ruperto Donoso.description: Ruperto Donoso was a jockey in the sport of Thoroughbred horse racing best known for riding Phalanx to victory in the 1947 Belmont Stakes. He also rode Gilded Knight to a second place finish in the 1939 Preakness Stakes. Wikipedia

John Maiben.label: John Maiben
John Maiben.description: John Maiben was "one of America's top jockeys during the 1920s" in the sport of Thoroughbred horse racing who won the 1926 Preakness Stakes, run that year as the first leg of the U.S. Triple Crown series. Wikipedia
John Maiben.Born: February 13, 1898 (age 116), Mount Pleasant, Utah, United States

Burley E. Parke.label: Burley Parke
Burley E. Parke.description: Burley Elijah Parke was an American jockey and a Hall of Fame trainer in the sport of Thoroughbred horse racing. Wikipedia

William Harmatz.label: William Harmatz
William Harmatz.description: William Harmatz was an American Thoroughbred horse racing jockey who won the 1959 Preakness Stakes aboard Royal Orbit. Wikipedia

Jeffrey Fell.label: Jeffrey Fell
Jeffrey Fell.description: Jeffrey J. Fell is a retired jockey and a Canadian Horse Racing Hall of Fame inductee who was also a successful rider in the United States. He was referenced in the song Jeff Fell Dream on the 2009 album Setting the Paces by the rock band BOAT. Wikipedia

Christopher Emigh.label: Christopher Emigh
Christopher Emigh.description: Christopher Alan Emigh is a jockey in American Thoroughbred horse racing. He earned his first win as a professional at Evangeline Downs in 1989. Wikipedia

Billy Pearson.label: Billy Pearson
Billy Pearson.description: Bill A. Pearson was an American jockey in thoroughbred horse racing, a quiz-show winner, and an art dealer. Wikipedia

Noel Meade.label: Noel Meade
Noel Meade.description: Noel Meade is a famous horse trainer from Castletown, Co. Meath, Ireland. He established Tu Va Stables in Co. Meath, Ireland as a place to train his horses. Wikipedia

Mickey Walls.label: Mickey Walls
Mickey Walls.description: Mickey K. Walls is a retired Thoroughbred horse racing jockey who was a Champion in both the United States and Canada. Wikipedia

Garnet Bougoure.label: Garnet Bougoure
Garnet Bougoure.description: Garnet Bougoure was an Australian jockey in Thoroughbred horse racing who was highly successful competing in South-East Asia and in Europe. Wikipedia

Chantal Sutherland.label: Chantal Sutherland
Chantal Sutherland.description: Chantal Sutherland is a Canadian model, television personality and jockey in North American Thoroughbred horse racing. She is referred to as the Danica Patrick of horse racing. Wikipedia

Stephen A. DiMauro.label: Stephen A. DiMauro
Stephen A. DiMauro.description: Stephen A. "Steve" DiMauro is a retired jockey, Champion trainer and successful breeder and owner in American Thoroughbred horse racing. Wikipedia
Stephen A. DiMauro.Born: November 29, 1932 (age 81), Camden, New Jersey, United States

Larry Melancon.label: Larry Melancon
Larry Melancon.description:
Larry J. Melancon is an American jockey in Thoroughbred horse racing who rides primarily on the Kentucky-Arkansas circuit.
Melancon began racing horses at age nine at local bush tracks and at age sixteen obtained his jockeys license. Wikipedia
Larry Melancon.Born: August 7, 1955 (age 58), Breaux Bridge, Louisiana, United States

Mark Guidry.label: Mark Guidry
Mark Guidry.description: Mark Guidry is an American jockey. He currently ranks 22nd among jockeys in career wins with 5,219 wins as of March 7, 2014. He has the sixth most wins among active jockeys. Wikipedia

Donnie Meche.label: Donnie Meche
Donnie Meche.description:
Donnie James Meche is an American jockey in Thoroughbred horse racing.
Donnie Meche won his first race at Evangeline Downs in May 1993. He was the top apprentice rider at Louisiana Downs in 1994. Wikipedia

Joseph Talamo.label: Joseph Talamo
Joseph Talamo.description:
Joseph Talamo is a Champion jockey in American Thoroughbred horse racing.
Born and raised in Marrero on the West Bank of the Mississippi River, within the Greater New Orleans Metropolitan area, Joe ... Wikipedia

Emma-Jayne Wilson.label: Emma-Jayne Wilson
Emma-Jayne Wilson.description: Emma-Jayne Wilson is a Sovereign and Eclipse Award-winning jockey in Thoroughbred horse racing. The daughter of a computer programmer and a corporate marketing executive, she began taking riding lessons as a girl of nine. Wikipedia

Arthur E. Redfern.label: Arthur E. Redfern
Arthur E. Redfern.description: Arthur Redfern was an American Thoroughbred horse racing jockey who in 1903 was the highest paid rider in the United States. Wikipedia

Harry Vega.label: Harry Vega
Harry Vega.description:
Harry Vega is an American jockey in Thoroughbred horse racing.
Vega began his riding career in Michigan in 1983 then in the late 1980s moved to compete at tracks on the Northeast coast of the United States. Wikipedia
Harry Vega.Born: September 21, 1965 (age 48), New Brunswick, New Jersey, United States

Wallace Dollase.label: Wallace Dollase
Wallace Dollase.description:
Wallace A. "Wally" Dollase is an American trainer and owner of Thoroughbred racehorses.
Among his numerous Graded stakes race wins, Dollase won the 1996 Breeders' Cup Distaff with Jewel Princess who ... Wikipedia
Wallace Dollase.Born: August 1, 1937 (age 76), Fort Atkinson, Wisconsin, United States

John L. Rotz.label: John L. Rotz
John L. Rotz.description: John L. Rotz is a retired American Thoroughbred horse racing jockey and an active World Champion in Western riding competitions. Wikipedia

Patrick Husbands.label: Patrick Husbands
Patrick Husbands.description: Patrick Husbands is a Barbadian jockey in Thoroughbred horse racing. The son of a jockey, he began riding as a young boy, turning professional in his home country where he rode successfully until emigrating to Toronto, Ontario in 1994. Wikipedia

Jose Valdivia, Jr..label: Jose Valdivia, Jr.
Jose Valdivia, Jr..description: Jose Valdivia, Jr. is a jockey in American Thoroughbred horse racing. The son of a top South American jockey, he is the nephew of retired jockey Fernando Toro and trainer, Juan Suarez. Wikipedia

Sally A. Bailie.label: Sally A. Bailie
Sally A. Bailie.description: Sally Anne Bailie was an English-born trainer and owner of Thoroughbred racehorses who competed was one of the first female trainers to win major American Graded stakes races. Wikipedia

Wendell Eads.label: Wendell Eads
Wendell Eads.description: Wendell W. Eads was an American Thoroughbred horse racing jockey. In the early 1940s he was a contract jockey with the prestigious Calumet Farm. Wikipedia

William P. Burch.label: William P. Burch
William P. Burch.description: William Preston Burch was an American Thoroughbred horse racing Hall of Fame trainer. A native of South Carolina, William Burch served as a courier in the Confederate States Army under Lieut. Gen. Wade Hampton III during the American Civil War. Wikipedia

Albert Johnson (jockey).label: Albert Johnson
Albert Johnson (jockey).description: Albert M. Johnson was an American Hall of Fame jockey. Born in the rural community of Milan, Washington, Albert Johnson began his career in 1917 at Playfair Race Track in nearby Spokane. Wikipedia

Jonathan C. Jones.label: Jonathan C. Jones
Jonathan C. Jones.description: Jonathan C. "Jono" Jones is a jockey in Thoroughbred horse racing who has won each of the Canadian Triple Crown races. Wikipedia

Martin S. Schwartz.label: Martin Schwartz
Martin S. Schwartz.description: Martin S. Schwartz is a Wall Street trader who made his fortune successfully trading stocks, futures and options. He received national attention when he won the U.S. Investing Championship in 1984. Wikipedia
Books: Pit Bull Lessons from Wall Street's Champion Day Trader

Pete Bostwick.label: Pete Bostwick
Pete Bostwick.description: George Herbert "Pete" Bostwick was an American court tennis player, a steeplechase jockey and horse trainer, and an eight-goal polo player. Wikipedia

Slade Callaghan.label: Slade Callaghan
Slade Callaghan.description:
Slade Callaghan is a jockey in Thoroughbred horse racing.
Considered tall for a jockey at 5' 8", Callaghan competed in his native Barbados where his success led him to relocate in 1994 to a base at Woodbine Racetrack in Toronto, Canada. Wikipedia

Earl Sande.label: Earl Sande
Earl Sande.description:
Earl Harold Sande was an American Hall of Fame jockey and thoroughbred horse trainer.
Born in Groton, South Dakota, Earl Sande started out as a bronco buster in the early 1900s but then became a successful ... Wikipedia
Earl Sande.Born: November 13, 1898, Groton, South Dakota, United States

William J. Passmore.label: William J. Passmore
William J. Passmore.description: William J. "Bill" Passmore, Sr. was an American jockey and racing steward, who rode thoroughbred horses for 38 years including at the Kentucky Derby, Preakness Stakes and Belmont Stakes winning 3,531 ... Wikipedia
William J. Passmore.Born: March 8, 1933, West Chester, Pennsylvania, United States

Jack M. Lauzon.label: Jack M. Lauzon
Jack M. Lauzon.description: Jack M. Lauzon is a retired Canadian Thoroughbred horse racing jockey whom The Blood-Horse magazine called "one of the most respected riders in Canada." Wikipedia

Javier Castellano.label: Javier Castellano
Javier Castellano.description:
Javier Castellano is a jockey in American Thoroughbred horse racing.
Castellano began his riding career in La Rinconada and Santa Rita racetracks. Wikipedia

Benny Marinelli.label: Benny Marinelli
Benny Marinelli.description: Benny Marinelli was an American Thoroughbred horse racing jockey best known for winning the Classic Preakness Stakes in 1923. Wikipedia

Wayne D. Wright.label: Wayne D. Wright
Wayne D. Wright.description: Wayne Danforth Wright was a Champion American Thoroughbred horse racing jockey who won all three of the Triple Crown races in different years. Wikipedia

Sam Maple.label: Sam Maple
Sam Maple.description:
Samuel A. Maple was an American jockey in Thoroughbred horse racing.
Born in Carrollton, Ohio, Sam Maple was one of eight brothers and sisters. His older brother, Eddie, was also a jockey. Wikipedia

Mümin Çılgın.label: Mümin Çılgın
Mümin Çılgın.description:
Mümin Çılgın is a Turkish former racehorse jockey, best known for his record winning of nine races at the Gazi Race, Turkey's most prestigious horse racing event.
He was born 1935 in Tekirdağ. In 1953, he left his hometown to go to Istanbul. Wikipedia

Hardy Campbell, Jr..label: Hardy Campbell, Jr.
Hardy Campbell, Jr..description: Hardy Campbell, Jr. was an American Thoroughbred horse racing trainer and Standardbred horse owner. Wikipedia

Charles B. Borel.label: Charles B. Borel
Charles B. Borel.description:
Charles B. Borel was an American Thoroughbred horse racing jockey best known for winning the 1917 Kentucky Derby.
Borel rode for prominent stable owners such as Harry Payne Whitney and James Butler. Wikipedia

Walter Blum.label: Walter Blum
Walter Blum.description: Walter Blum is a retired Hall of Fame jockey. Wikipedia
Walter Blum.Born: September 28, 1934 (age 79), Brooklyn, New York, United States

Willie Simms.label: Willie Simms
Willie Simms.description:
Willie Simms was an American Hall of Fame thoroughbred horse racing jockey.
Simms began racing in 1887 and was one of the most successful jockeys using the short-stirrup style. Wikipedia

Warren Mehrtens.label: Warren Mehrtens
Warren Mehrtens.description:
Warren Mehrtens was an American Thoroughbred horse racing jockey best known for winning the U.S. Triple Crown in 1946.
Born in Brooklyn, New York, Warren Mehrtens graduated from Jamaica High School in 1938. Wikipedia
Warren Mehrtens.Born: November 5, 1920, Brooklyn, New York, United States

Robert P. Tiller.label: Robert Tiller
Robert P. Tiller.description: Robert Tiller is a Canadian Thoroughbred racehorse trainer. A resident of Brampton, Ontario, in 1972 he embarked on a career conditioning horses and in 2007 marked the eighteenth straight year he has ... Wikipedia

Roy L. Gilbert.label: Roy L. Gilbert
Roy L. Gilbert.description: Roy Lee Gilbert was an American Thoroughbred horse racing jockey who died as a result of a racing accident. An Associated Press news release at the time of his death called him "one of the most promising young jockeys in the country." Wikipedia

Frank Lovato, Jr..label: Frank Lovato, Jr.
Frank Lovato, Jr..description: Frank "Frankie" Lovato, Jr. is a retired Award-winning American Thoroughbred jockey, inventor, musician, writer and educator of horse racing. His racing career spanned from 1979 until 2004. Wikipedia

Rafael Meza.label: Rafael Meza
Rafael Meza.description:
Rafael Q. Meza is a retired jockey who competed in Thoroughbred horse racing in the United States.
A native of Tijuana, Mexico, Meza began riding in California near the end of the 1970s. and would spend his career riding from a base in that State. Wikipedia

Roger Laurin.label: Roger Laurin
Roger Laurin.description: Roger Laurin is a trainer of Thoroughbred racehorses in the United States and Canada. He has trained Champions Numbered Account, the 1971 American Champion Two-Year-Old Filly, and Chief's Crown, the ... Wikipedia

Wayne M. Catalano.label: Wayne M. Catalano
Wayne M. Catalano.description: Wayne M. Catalano is a former jockey and current trainer in American Thoroughbred horse racing who has won three Breeders' Cup World Championship races and trained two Eclipse Award Champions. Wikipedia
Wayne M. Catalano.Born: July 24, 1956 (age 57), New Orleans, Louisiana, United States

Devereux Milburn.label: Devereux Milburn
Devereux Milburn.description: Devereux Milburn was an American champion polo player in the early to mid twentieth century. He was one of what was known as the Big Four in international polo, winning the Westchester Cup six times. Wikipedia
Devereux Milburn.Born: September 19, 1881, Buffalo, New York, United States

Jerry D. Bailey.label: Jerry Bailey
Jerry D. Bailey.description: Jerry D. Bailey is a retired American Hall of Fame jockey. He began his racing career in November 1974. His first mount was on a horse named Pegged Rate, who ran off the board. Wikipedia
Nominations: Sports Emmy Award for Outstanding Sports Personality - Sports Event Analyst

Jeffrey Sanchez (jockey).label: Jeffrey Sanchez
Jeffrey Sanchez (jockey).description: Jeffrey Sanchez is a jockey in American Thoroughbred horse racing best known for winning the 2010 Breeders' Cup Juvenile Fillies aboard Awesome Feather with whom he also swept the Florida Stallion Stakes at Calder Race Course. Wikipedia

Clarence Kummer.label: Clarence Kummer
Clarence Kummer.description:
Clarence Kummer was a U.S. Racing Hall of Fame jockey who won four American Classic Races.
In early 1920, Kummer rode the 1919 Triple Crown Champion Sir Barton to a new Saratoga track record in winning the Saratoga Handicap. Wikipedia
Clarence Kummer.Born: August 8, 1899, New York City, New York, United States

Anthony DeSpirito.label: Anthony DeSpirito
Anthony DeSpirito.description: Anthony "Tony" DeSpirito was a champion American Thoroughbred horse racing jockey who found instant fame when he won the national riding title in 1952 as an apprentice in his first full year of racing. Wikipedia

Felix L. Ortiz.label: Felix L. Ortiz
Felix L. Ortiz.description: Felix Luis Ortiz is a jockey in American Thoroughbred horse racing. He learned to ride in his native Puerto Rico, attending the El Commandante Jockey School. He currently rides for the New Jersey and Florida racing circuit. Wikipedia
Felix L. Ortiz.Born: April 28, 1971 (age 42), Puerto Rico, United States, with Territories

Barbara J. Minshall.label: Barbara J. Minshall
Barbara J. Minshall.description: Barbara J. Minshall is a Canadian Thoroughbred racehorse trainer and owner who has competed both in Canada and the United States. Wikipedia
